issue.title: FYI: open-quantum-safe/rust team has crates.io push access
issue.body:
I see that there is some new bot set up to provision access control and maintainer status through the configuration file that is owned by this repository. Please note that:

- the `open-quantum-safe/rust` team (which I am guessing is not part of this new system) has permissions to push to crates.io, so its membership should probably also get managed by the TSC / this new system in some way, 
- removing the `open-quantum-safe/rust` team would result in ownership of https://crates.io/crates/oqs getting lost (except that it is still registered to my account directly).

issue.title: How to run quantum-safe KEM algorithms?
issue.body:
Hi there,

I am trying to use the quantum-safe KEM algorithms (specifically mlkem512) in a simple example to encapsulate/decapsulate a symmetric key, aes-256, that in turn will be used to encrypt/decrypt a text file. I am not sure how to run any of these KEM algorithms on the command line in my Ubuntu terminal. I was able to run a simple example of signing a text file with falcon512 but am getting errors when I try the KEM example.

**Code version/branch I am using:**
I managed to follow the instructions for cloning and installing https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-provider.git correctly. 

**$ openssl list -providers**
Providers:
  default
    name: OpenSSL Default Provider
    version: 3.0.10
    status: active
  oqsprovider
    name: OpenSSL OQS Provider
    version: 0.5.4-dev
    status: active

**OpenSSL version running on my machine:**
**$ openssl version**
OpenSSL 3.0.10 1 Aug 2023 (Library: OpenSSL 3.0.10 1 Aug 2023)

**Attempted KEM commands with errors:**
**$openssl genpkey -algorithm mlkem512 -out sk.key**
Error writing key
40A72FFF707A0000:error:1D800065:ENCODER routines:OSSL_ENCODER_to_bio:reason(101):../crypto/encode_decode/encoder_lib.c:55:No encoders were found. For standard encoders you need at least one of the default or base providers available. Did you forget to load them?
40A72FFF707A0000:error:04800073:PEM routines:do_pk8pkey:error converting private key:../crypto/pem/pem_pk8.c:133:

**$ openssl genpkey -aes-256-cbc -algorithm mlkem512 -out sk.pem**
Error writing key
40B75A1CEE7C0000:error:1D800065:ENCODER routines:OSSL_ENCODER_to_bio:reason(101):../crypto/encode_decode/encoder_lib.c:55:No encoders were found. For standard encoders you need at least one of the default or base providers available. Did you forget to load them?
40B75A1CEE7C0000:error:04800073:PEM routines:do_pk8pkey:error converting private key:../crypto/pem/pem_pk8.c:133:

Please could you let me know what exactly I am doing incorrectly and how to run my KEM example. Thanks.
